servinfo.title: DTC P2103: Throttle Actuator Control Motor Circuit High

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P2101: Throttle Actuator Control Motor Circuit Range / Performance .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Power supply current of throttle actuator control circuit is higher than specification for more than 0.5 sec.

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC by using scan tool if any.
Keep ignition switch is at ON position for 5 seconds or longer.
Check DTC by using scan tool.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from electric throttle body assembly and ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper terminal connection to electric throttle body assembly and ECM connectors.
If connections are OK, check that throttle actuator motor circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of each throttle actuator motor drive circuit (1 and 2) is less than 3 Ω
Insulation resistance between each throttle actuator motor drive circuit (1 and 2) and vehicle body ground is Infinity
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between throttle actuator motor drive terminal (1) and each other terminal at electric throttle body connector
Circuit voltage of each throttle actuator motor drive circuit (1 and 2) is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: Repair or replace throttle actuator motor drive circuit(s).

test1.ptxt: Check electric throttle body for performance referring to Electric Throttle Body Assembly On-Vehicle Inspection .

action.ptxt: Substitute a known good ECM and recheck.
Repair or replace electric throttle body assembly.
